author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: إِلَيْكَ وَأَقُولُ يا قَوْمِ فَانْظُرُوا بِمَا عِنْدَكُمْ مِنْ آياتِ اللَّهِ رَبِّكُمْ وَبِما نُزِّلَ مِنْ سَمَاءِ المَشِيَّةِ وَالاقْتِدَارِ يَعتَرِضُونَ عَلَيْكَ وَيُعْرِضُونَ عَنْكَ بَعْدَ الَّذِيْ أَنْتَ تَعْلَمُ بِأَنَّ كُلَّ كَلِمَةٍ مِنْ كَلِمَاتِ الَّتِيْ خَرَجَ
translation: I know, O my Lord, neither their reasoning with which they have acknowledged Thee and believed in Thy signs, nor their argument whereby they have repudiated Thy sovereignty. Every time I call them to Thee and say: “O people! Consider the utterances of the Lord your God which are in your possession and those that have been sent down from the heaven of His will and power,” they cavil at Thee, and turn their backs to Thee, though—as Thou art aware—each of the words that have gone out of the mouth of Thy will sheddeth the fragrance of the breaths of Thy mercy.
